name: Propaganda Deconstruction
description: Analyzing and dismantling psychological manipulation techniques embedded in media, politics, and education.

cards.title: Detecting Manipulative Framing in News and Media
cards.description: Understanding how narratives are shaped to control public perception.
bulletpoints: Identifying selective framing and omission of facts in mainstream media.
Analyzing the role of emotional triggers in propaganda.
Tracking linguistic patterns designed to induce compliance or fear.
cards.summaryText: Expose selective framing, chart emotional trigger usage, and catalog compliance-driving language.

cards.title: The Science of Subliminal Messaging and Symbolism
cards.description: Exposing the use of subliminal techniques to influence unconscious thought.
bulletpoints: Recognizing hidden symbols in corporate logos, advertisements, and films.
Understanding the role of neuro-linguistic programming (NLP) in conditioning.
Deconstructing repeated motifs in entertainment media that reinforce compliance.
cards.summaryText: Spot covert symbols, decode NLP conditioning, and log recurring compliance motifs.

cards.title: Reverse Engineering Social Engineering Tactics
cards.description: Breaking down the step-by-step process of large-scale social manipulation.
bulletpoints: Mapping out how fear-based narratives are weaponized.
Recognizing artificial crisis events designed to manufacture consent.
Tracing financial and institutional backing behind disinformation campaigns.
cards.summaryText: Reverse engineer fear scripts, flag staged-crisis consent plays, and follow the money behind disinfo.
